page.title: 12LIFE STYLES 1
page.content: There are about{150 caravans}on the site at Plucks Gutter. Their owners come down at weekends and for holidays and are joined by{'tent campers'}in the summer. During the warm months a kind of village community appears, whose local point is the Dog and Duck. The 'Caravaners' have little contact with Stourmouth as their is no shop or post office. They drive to Canterbury on Thanet for all their needs. It is a happy community, likened to the{East {End of London.}Everyone knows and helps their neighbours, and there are some wonderful 'characters'. On retirement some Caravaners buy houses {in the village,}but often regret doing so. They say they find no friendly atmosphere since few of the old farming population remain. The 'weekenders have come here to get away from people anyway.
